verses.verse: which none of the rulers of this age knew; for (Luke 23:34) had they known, they would not have (Matt. 27:33-50) crucified the Lord of glory.
But as it is written: ((Is. 64:4; 65:17)) “Eye has not seen, nor ear heard, Nor have entered into the heart of man The things which God has prepared for those who love Him.”
But (Matt. 11:25; 13:11; 16:17; (Gal. 1:12; Eph. 3:3, 5)) God has revealed them to us through His Spirit. For the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God.

For what man knows the things of a man except the (Job 32:8; Eccl. 12:7; (1 Cor. 6:20; James 2:26)) spirit of the man which is in him? (Rom. 11:33) Even so no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God.
Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but ((Rom. 8:15)) the Spirit who is from God, that we might know the things that have been freely given to us by God.
These things we also speak, not in words which man’s wisdom teaches but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual.
(Matt. 16:23) But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him; nor can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
But he who is spiritual judges all things, yet he himself is rightly judged by no one.
For (Job 15:8; Is. 40:13; Rom. 11:34) “who has known the mind of the LORD that he may instruct Him?” ((John 15:15)) But we have the mind of Christ.
Sectarianism Is Carnal And I, brethren, could not speak to you as to spiritual people but as to carnal, as to (1 Cor. 2:6; Eph. 4:14; Heb. 5:13) babes in Christ.
I fed you with (Heb. 5:12; 1 Pet. 2:2) milk and not with solid food; (John 16:12) for until now you were not able to receive it, and even now you are still not able;
for you are still carnal. For where there are envy, strife, and divisions among you, are you not carnal and behaving like mere men?
For when one says, “I am of Paul,” and another, “I am of Apollos,” are you not carnal?

Watering, Working, Warning Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but (Rom. 15:16; 2 Cor. 3:3, 6; 4:1; 5:18; 6:4; Eph. 3:7; Col. 1:25; 1 Tim. 1:12) ministers through whom you believed, as the Lord gave to each one?
(Acts 18:4; 1 Cor. 4:15; 9:1; 15:1; 2 Cor. 10:14) I planted, (Acts 18:24-27; 1 Cor. 1:12) Apollos watered, ((2 Cor. 3:5)) but God gave the increase.
So then (2 Cor. 12:11; (Gal. 6:3)) neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase.
Now he who plants and he who waters are one, (Ps. 62:12; Rom. 2:6) and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
For (Mark 16:20; Acts 15:4; 2 Cor. 6:1) we are God’s fellow workers; you are God’s field, you are ((1 Cor. 3:16; Eph. 2:20-22); Col. 2:7; Heb. 3:3, 4; (1 Pet. 2:5)) God’s building.

(Rom. 1:5) According to the grace of God which was given to me, as a wise master builder I have laid (1 Cor. 4:15) the foundation, and another builds on it. But let each one take heed how he builds on it.
For no other foundation can anyone lay than (Is. 28:16; Matt. 16:18; 2 Cor. 11:4) that which is laid, (Eph. 2:20; 1 Pet. 2:4) which is Jesus Christ.
Now if anyone builds on this foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, straw,
each one’s work will become clear; for the Day (1 Pet. 1:7) will declare it, because (Mal. 3:1-3; Luke 2:35) it will be revealed by fire; and the fire will test each one’s work, of what sort it is.
If anyone’s work which he has built on it endures, he will receive a reward.
